explanation: The condition mistakenly compared s[i][0] (price) to s[j][1] (the count 'c') instead of s[j][0] (the other item's price). I fixed that one index so the price-to-price comparison is correct: s[j][1] -> s[j][0].
fixed_code:
n,m=map(int,input().split())
s=[]
for i in range(n):
  p,c,*f=map(int,input().split())
  s.append([p,c,f])
for i in range(n):
  for j in range(n):
    if i!=j and s[i][0]>=s[j][0] and set(s[j][2])>=set(s[i][2]) \
            and (s[i][0]>s[j][0] or set(s[j][2])-set(s[i][2])):
      print("Yes")
      exit()
print("No")
